Package com.glitchybyte.glib.console

Class GConsole

java.lang.Object
com.glitchybyte.glib.console.GConsole
public final class GConsole extends Object
Helper class to print color text to console. It assumes 256 colors (at least). If there is no console, it will do nothing.

Example usage: 

 
 GConsole.print("This is " + GConsole.coloredText("cyan", GConsole.COLOR_CYAN, null) + " text.\n");
 GConsole.println("And this is %s text.", GConsole.coloredText("orange", GConsole.rgb(5, 2, 1), null));
 GConsole.flush();
See Also:
  • CSI sequences

    • coloredText

      Parameters:

      fgColor - Foreground color code.
      Returns:
      String with encoded command.

    • flush

      public static void flush()
      Flushes all printed commands.

      It is possible console will not update until it's flushed. Flush when you want to make sure the user sees your print output.
